title: Fork, ""Tipsy Tavener"", late 18th–mid-19th century
creditline: Gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
description: Four tine fork with faceted shank. Handle formed as a fully modelled, carved ivory bearded man leaning to his right, clutching a drinking cup close to his side with his right hand and his belly with his left hand, a flask hung over his shoulder. He stands on a coiled serpent.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Fork, ""Tipsy Tavener"", late 18th–mid-19th century.
late 18th–mid-19th century. ivory, later silver-plated metal tines. Gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop. 1951-84-15.
